answerText: Shahnameh [or Shah-Nama; or The Book of Kings][10] The most tragic and famous story from the Shahnameh ends with this precocious braggart son of Tahmina unwittingly being slain by his own father Rustam.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Seven Lakes/Rockefeller  | 1 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: After praising God and Wisdom in its opening, it relates the story of Keyumars, who was granted farr by Ahura Mazda and became the first shah. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Persian epic which also depicts the romance of Bijan and Manijeh and was written by Ferdowsi.
